subject: Fruits/Pies/Puddings
ingredients: apples; flour; baking powder; salt; egg; shortening; cinnamon; cream
object_transcript: BETTY CROCKER APPLE CRISP; Place in greased 6x10' baking dish 5 to 6 cups sliced pared or unpared apples (about 6 tart firm apples); Mix together with fork until crumbly and sprinkle over the apples:; 1 cup flour; 1/2 to 1 cup sugar, depending on the tartness of apples.; 1 teaspoon baking powder; 3/4 teaspoon salt; unbeaten egg; Pour over all 1/3 cup melted and cooled shortening; Sprinkle with 1/2 tsp. cinnamon; bake 30 - 40 minutes in a moderate over (350°); Serve warm with cream - 8 servings
image_alt_text: A recipe for Apple Crisp written in cursive black ink. The paper is a white notecard, one side lined.

recipe_form: clipping; promotional material; printed ink; ephemera
subject: Fruits/Pies/Puddings
ingredients: apples; sugar; nutmeg; butter; Crustquick or other crust
object_transcript: Apple Pie; Make Pastry of 9-in. 2-crust Pie; Mix well 6 to 7 cups thinly sliced, tart juicy apples (peeled, quartered, cored); with mixture of 3/4 to 1 cup sugar (depending on tartness of apples); 1 tsp. cinnamon or nutmeg; Fill pastry-lined pie plate; Dot with 1 tbsp. butter; Adjust top crust. To seal, see directions for Two-Crust Pies on Crustquick package. Bake 50 to 60 minutes in hot oven (425) until crust is nicely browned and apples cooked through (test with fork). Serve warm.; Dutch Apple Pie: 5 minutes before baking time is up, remove pie from oven. Pour 1/2 cup heavy cream through slits in top crust. Return to oven and continue baking.; "Mince" Apple Pie: Mix with sugar 1 tsp. cinnamon, 1/2 tsp. cloves, 1/4 tsp. mace, 1/8 tsp. salt, 1/2 cup raisins, 1 tsp. molasses.; Streusel Apple Pie: In place of top crust, sprinkle over sweetened apples a mixture of 1/2 pkg. Crustquick (about 1 cup), 1/3 cup brown dugar, 1/2 tsp. cinnamon. Bake as for Apple Pie.; over; Now make pie crust like Betty Crocker's; easy with Crustquick!; Our new pie crust mix is based on the pastry method perfected by Betty Crocker and her General MIlls staff though years of food experience. Crustquick gives you Betty Crocker's pie crust in a package. Just add water.; For all your pies! Makes crisp, tender, flaky crust every time. Gold Medal Enriched Flour is used in Crustquick. Also shortening especially good for pastry. Try Crustquick now.; General Mills; See other side for delicious pie filling recipes; "Betty Crocker" is a trade name of General Mills, Inc.
image_alt_text: Promotional recipes for Betty Crocker, printed in blue and black ink on white cardstock. On the back there is an advertisement for Crustquick
rights: General Mills, Inc. holds the copyright. Recipe is available for personal use but not widespread publication.

subject: Cakes/Cookies
ingredients: fat; sugar; unsweetened applesauce; soda; chopped raisins; flour; cloves; cinnamon; nutmeg; salt
object_transcript: Apple Sauce Cake; 1/2 cup fat; 1 cup sugar; 1 cup unsweetened, thick, smooth apple sauce; 1 teaspoon soda --> Disolved in 2 tablespoons water; 1 cup chopped raisins (seedless); 1 1/2 cups sifted flour; 1/2 teaspoon cloves; 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon; 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg; 1/2 teaspoon salt; Cream the fat and sugar together, add the apple sauce. Mix the raisins with one-half cup of the flour; sift the rest with the spices, soda, and salt, and add the dry ingredients to the mixture. Beat well, pour into a greased pan, and bake in a moderate oven for about 1 hour.; Aunt Sammy; no eggs??
image_alt_text: A recipe for Apple Sauce Cake typed in pica 10 typeface on a white notecard, with handwritten notes and substitutions in pencil. There are stains and fading altering the text.

subject: Fruits/Pies/Puddings
ingredients: tapioca; water; sugar; cinnamon; salt; lemon juice; apples; whipped cream
object_transcript: Apple Tapioca; 1/2 cup tapioca; 2 cups boiling water; 1/2 cup sugar; 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon; 1/2 teaspoon salt; Juice of 1 Lemon; 3 pints sliced apples; Add the boiling water to the tapioca and cook in double boiler for 15 min. Add the sugar, cinnamon, salt, and lemon juice. Place apples in a greased baking dish and pour tapioca over them. Bake until apples are tender. Serve with whipped cream.

subject: Fruits/Pies/Puddings
ingredients: apples; water; sugar; red cinnamon drops; chopped nuts; whipped cream; jelly
object_transcript: 1932; Margaret; Apples in Bloom; Peel and core apples (1 doz.); Cover with water, sweeten well and cook.; 1/2 cup red cinnamon drops - whickey killers 10¢; Turn apples - they will color evenly. Take out apples when tender and chill. Cook juice until it jellies and chill. Pour over apples. Fill cores with chopped nuts. Serve cold with whipped cream. Drop a little jelly on top of whipped cream.

subject: Brownies/Fudge
ingredients: unsweetened chocolate; flour; butter; sugar; chopped nuts; baking powder; salt; vanilla
object_transcript: Brownies; Bake 45 min to an hour, 300 to 325; 2 squares unsweetened chocolate; 1/2 cup butter; 2 eggs; 1 cup sugar; 1 cup finely chopped nuts; 1 cup sifted flour; 1 teaspoon baking powder; 1/2 teaspoon salt; 1/2 teaspoon vanilla; Melt the chocolate and fat together. Beat the eggs slightly, add the sugar, and the chopped nuts, which have been mixed with the flour, B. P., and salt. Stir in the chocolate and fat after they have cooled, and add the vanilla. Pour into a warm greased shallow pan lined with greased paper. Bake in a moderate oven(r) for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Turn from the pan and remove the paper while the cake is hot. Cut in Squares; Brownies will keep fresh for some time in a tin box.; Aunt Sammy.
image_alt_text: A recipe for brownies typed in pica 10 typeface on a white notecard, with handwritten notes and substitutions in pencil.

subject: Brownies/Fudge
ingredients: flour; baking powder; butter; Baker's Chocolate; sugar; eggs; vanilla; walnut meats; salt
object_transcript: Brownies; 3/4 cup sifted flour; 1/2 teaspoon baking powder.; 1/3 cup butter; 2 squares Bakers unsweetened chocolate, melted; 1 cup sugar; 2 eggs well beaten; 1 teaspoonful vanilla; 1/2 cup walnut meats, chopped; 1/2 teaspoon salt; Sift flour once, measure. Add baking powder and sift again. Add butter to chocolate and blend. Combine sugar and eggs. Add chocolate mixture, beating thoroughly, then flour, vanilla and nuts.; Pour into greased pan 8 x 8 x 2 inches, and bake in moderate oven(r) 350 F 35 minutes. Cut in squares before removing from pan. Makes 25 brownies.; Jennie Weston - Nov. 23, 1939.; (Thanksgiving by Proxy???); Baker's Chocolate recipe.
image_alt_text: A recipe for brownies typed in pica 10 typeface on a white notecard, with handwritten notes and substitutions in pencil.

object_transcript: Chocolate Icing; 2 squares Bakers chocolate (1-1/2 I find enough); 1-1/2 cups confectioners sugar; 2-1/2 tablespoons hot water; 2 egg yolks; 4 tablespoons butter; Melt choclate in double boiler. Remove from boiling water, add sugar and water and beat. Add egg yolks one at a time, beating well in each addition. Add butter 1 tablespoon at a time. Vanilla.

subject: Breads/Buns/Muffins
ingredients: flour; milk; sugar; chocolate; butter; eggs; baking powder; salt; vanilla
object_transcript: Feb. 3, 1930.; Chocolate Waffles (Dessert); 2 cups sifted flour; 1 1/2 cup milk; 1/4 cup sugar; 2 squares chocolate; 3 tablespoons butter; 2 eggs; 3 teaspoons baking powder; 1 teaspoon salt; 1/4 teaspoon vanilla; Mix dry ingredients; Melt butter; Lastly fold in the beaten whites of eggs; (If desired, sprinkle with powdered sugar.); Aunt Sammy, U.S. Dept. of Agr.

subject: Cakes/Cookies
ingredients: sugar; butter; water; flour; vanilla; egg whites; baking powder
object_transcript: Fine as silk.; Cold Water Cake; 1-2/3 cups sugar; 1/2 cup butter; 1 cup cold water; 2-1/2 cups flour; 1 teaspoon vanilla; 4 unbeaten egg whites; 3 teaspoons baking powder; Cream butter and sugar until like whipped cream. Add flour and water alternately. Add vanilla. Add egg whites and beat. Add baking powder last with 1/2 cup of the flour.; (Sophia says beat like the dickens.); Sophia Greim Holcomb. Warrensburg, Mo. Aug. 13, 1939.; Use 7-minute frosting.

subject: Cakes/Cookies
ingredients: butter; cream; brown sugar; white sugar; eggs; soda; water; salt; chopped nuts; Nestle's Semi-Sweet Chocolate morsels; vanilla; shortening
object_transcript: Cookies - Toll House Chocolate; Recipe from the Famouse Toll House at Whitman, Mass.; Cream; 1 cup butter, add; 3/4 cup brown sugar; 3/4 cup white sugar and; 2 eggs; 1 teaspoon soda in; 1 teaspoon hot water &; mix alternately with; 2 1/4 cups flour sifted; with 1 teaspoon salt.; Lastly add 1 cup chopped nuts and contents of bag of Nestle's Semi-Sweet Chocolate morsels.; Flavor with 1/2 tsp. vanilla; Drop by half teaspoons on a greased cookie sheet.; Bake 10 to 12 minutes.; Makes 50 cookies.; *Shortening may be substituted for butter.; Jan 1, 1941. (Jennie Weston)

subject: Cakes/Cookies
ingredients: shortening; sugar; eggs; flour; baking powder; salt; vanilla
object_transcript: Crispy Sugar Cookies; 1 cup shortening; 1 1/4 cup sugar; 2 eggs; 2 tsp vanilla; 2 cup flour; 1 1/2 tbs Baking Powder; 1 tsp salt; combine shortening sugar and eggs and vanilla in a large boat. Until well blended add flour BP and salt. Work ingredients together; over; with spoon until dough is smooth. [heat oven to 400 F0. Bake 8-10 minutes; I make them every time; Nellie Cole
image_alt_text: A recipe for Sugar Cookies written in cursive black ink on a white notecard.

recipe_form: printed ink; clipping; promotional material; ephemera
subject: Cakes/Cookies
ingredients: shortening; sugar; eggs; flour; salt; soda; sour milk; sweet milk; chocolate; vanilla
object_transcript: Devil's Food Cake; Rich, chocolatey, and velvety smooth; ... a Gold Medal favorite for years.; Shortening (1/2 cup); Sugar (1 1/4 cups); Eggs (2 large); Sifted GOLD MEDAL "Kitchen-tested" Flour (1 3/4 cups); Salt (1/2 tsp.); Soda (1 tsp.); Sour Milk (not too old) or Sweet (1 cup); Chocolate (2 sq. unsweetened - melted - 2oz.); Vanilla (1tsp.); Crea, shortening, add sugar gradually, and cream until fluffy. Blend in well beaten eggs. Sift flour, salt and soda together, and add to creamed mixture alternately with the milk. Blend in melted chocolate and vanilla. (The batter is very thin.); Pour into a well greased and floured 8 1/2-inch square pan or 2 round 8-inch or 9-inch layer pans. Bake 40 to 45 minutes for a square cake or 30 to 35 minutes for layers in a moderate oven (350).; NOTE: The use of sour milk or buttermilk makes this cake especially tender.' To Save On Sugar in Devil's Food Cake: Use 5/8 cup sugar and 5/8 cup syrup and reduce the liquid 2 tablespoons. Beat syrup into creamed shortening and sugar very gradually and thoroughly before gradually beating in well beaten eggs.
image_alt_text: A recipe for Devil's Food Cake with graphics provided by General Mills. There is a likeness of a Devil holding a cake at the top, and the likeness of a blonde Betty Crocker at the bottom.
rights: General Mills, Inc. holds the copyright. Recipe is available for personal use but not widespread publication.

subject: Breads/Buns/Muffins
ingredients: milk; sugar; crisco; salt; eggs; cakes yeast; flour
object_transcript: MRS. YAKISH ROLLS Dec. 31-1947; 191/20 cups milk (scald); 1 cup sugar; 2 tablespoons crisco (rounded); 2 teaspoons salt; 2 eggs; 2 cakes yeast; 4 or 5 cups of flour; Add sugar, crisco and salt to scalded milk. Add yeast and eggs after milk cools. Add just enough flour to make a soft dough that can be stirred, then put out on floured bread board -- into a soft dough with not too much flour. (The secret of good rolls is to keep the dough soft.) Let rise until dough doubles its bulk.; GLAZING; Mix together 3/4 cup brown sugar; 3/4 cup white cugar; shake in a little cinnamon; Heat together 1/2 cup (?) + 1/2 cup Crisco.; Dip each ball first in the fat mixture then in the sugar mixture, and put in muffin tins - 3 in each small section.; Bake rolls in large muffin tins. Put 3 small balls in each section.
image_alt_text: A recipe for Yakish Rolls written in cursive black ink. The paper is a white notecard, one side lined. There are water stains and fading altering the text.
recipe card front
recipe card back

subject: Fruits/Pies/Puddings
ingredients: cranberries; apples; water; chopped walnuts; celery, sugar; lemon gelatine; salt
object_transcript: SALAD - RUBY; 1 pint cranberries; 1/2 cup chopped apples; 3/4 cup hot water; 1/2 cup chopped walnuts; 1 cup sugar; 1/2 cup chopped celery; 1 pkg. lemon gelatine; pinch of salt; 1/2 cup boiling water; Wash cranberries, then cover and cook in the 3/4 cup of hot water until soft, rub through a strainer then add sugar, cook 5 minutes longer. Add the 1/2 cup boiling water and pour over the gelatine stirring until it is disolved - let cool. When it begins to congeal, add the chopped foods, pour into a mold, cover and place in a refridgerator until ready to serve.
image_alt_text: A recipe for Ruby Salad typed in black ink, pica 10 typeface on a white notecard, one side lined.

subject: Other
ingredients: egg; milk; water
object_transcript: To refreshen leather; Take whites of 3 eggs, one gill of milk, add water to make one pint, shake well and apply with a soft cloth. Margaret.
